name: Indira Gandhi Rashtriya Uran Akademi (IGRUA)
about: Indira Gandhi Rashtriya Uran Akademi (IGRUA) is a premier pilot training institute under the Ministry of Civil Aviation, Government of India, established in 1985. Located at Fursatganj Airfield in Uttar Pradesh, IGRUA is renowned for its high standards in aviation training, often likened to the IIT/IIM of aviation. The institute offers comprehensive training programs, including the Commercial Pilot License (CPL) with Multi-Engine Endorsement and a concurrent B.Sc. in Aviation. IGRUA boasts a state-of-the-art fleet, modern navigational aids, and excellent sports facilities. It has collaborations with Indian Navy, Coast Guard, and other national carriers, ensuring excellent placement opportunities. With a dedicated airfield, ATC, and flight simulators, IGRUA provides a holistic learning environment, making it a top choice for aspiring pilots. IGRUA is committed to delivering exceptional aviation training, adhering to international standards and safety protocols.
